DataKind Remote Data for Good Fellowship 2026

Remote fellowship working with nonprofits to deliver data science projects for social impact.

CompanyDataKind
RoleData for Good Fellow
LocationRemote
Duration10–12 weeks
StipendExpected/Indicative: stipend depends on project funding
Work HoursFull-time remote
Employment TypeIntern
ExperienceHands-on data science/analytics

Eligibility & Skills

  • Data/ML practitioners with portfolios; interest in social impact
  • Education: UG/PG or professionals
  • Branches allowed: Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics
  • Skills: Python/R data science, SQL, Visualization, Stakeholder communication
  • Year of study: UG/PG or recent grads
  • Age limit: Per program policy

DataKind Remote Data for Good Fellowship 2026

Introduction

DataKind pairs data teams with nonprofits. This remote fellowship focuses on applied data science for social impact. Dates/stipend are Expected/Indicative.

Program Overview

  • Remote collaboration with DataKind staff and nonprofit partners
  • Scoping, modeling, dashboards, and handoff playbooks
  • Weekly milestones; certificate and possible stipend

Eligibility

  • Evidence of data work (notebooks, repos, dashboards)
  • Comfort with async client communication

How to Apply

  1. Share CV + portfolio via DataKind opportunities. 2) Indicate domain interests (health, education, climate). 3) Complete any take-home or interview.

FAQs

  • Paid? Expected/Indicative: stipend depends on project funding.
  • Remote? Yes, fully remote.
  • Prior NGO experience? Helpful but not required; show impact focus.

Ready to apply?

Applications close on 15 March 2026.
